intro: Ageratum microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with white or pale blue centers, and bloom throughout the growing season. Ageratum microcarpum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes for its vibrant appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
